title: best champion for NEVER losing a tower?
body:
I hate losing towers. I don't even care about dying or losing cs, I just can't stand losing my tower before taking the enemy tower.

What's the best champion for never losing a tower?

replies.body:
Is that even a question???

Obviously the one and only {{champion:74}}!!!!
Heim is the best yeah, very good sustain.
Nasus? He gets ganked like no tomorrow.
Sion's great for that since you can quickly clear waves with your E and Q. Plus you have TP and R to get back to lane if you have to recall.
Do you really ult back into lane?
It could be useful. His ult does scale with distance travelled and if the enemy is in a bad situation even better.
but does it reach from fountain to outer turret?
Are you implying the only way to use it as such would be straight from the fountain?
i am not implying that at all, they said they use the ult once they respawn, so they imply from the fountain.
Not really. They never specified using it as soon as they re-spawned or from the fountain, just "Plus you have TP and R to get back to lane if you have to recall."
mordekaiser. all u do is stand by the tower until 16 cause u cant do ANYTHING until then. farm and farm some more. lv 16 comes. 1 shot. 1 shot. tower siege
lux and xerath are probably the safest but easiest against a non poking laner would be zed
Aniv and heim are my favourite tower defenders. Lissandra's not bad either, if you want to play that way.
Play {{champion:86}} and go full tank (get {{item:3083}}  & {{item:3065}} to help with passive healing)
